title: I get the lucian nerfs, but the runaan's change and guinsoo change are NOT bugfixes, stop lying
body:
Passive - Lightslinger
BUGFIX The second shot no longer procs Runaan’s Hurricane or Guinsoo’s Rageblade, since it’s not a basic attack

That's why it crits and lifesteals, right? That's why it procs botrk, right?

replies.body: Oh dear, it seems you've mistaken on-attack and on-hit effects.

On-Hit effects and On-Attack effects are different.

Lightslinger is, in its simplest terms, a built-in Guinsoo's. It does damage and procs on-hit effects, like what Guinsoo's does. Before this, Lucian could get three procs of stuff; one from his attack, one from his Lightslinger, and one from Guinsoo's since Lightslinger proc'd it. Lightslinger is an extra on-hit, not an extra attack.

Then why does Lightslinger proc stuff like Braum shield? This isn't a very clearly defined mechanic which is why I posted what I did. I don't mind Lucian nerfs at all, really. But if there's a difference between on hit and on attack there needs to be a clearly defined difference and not this awkwardness.
that's still an on hit effect.

Braum's passive stacks on-hit, so Lightslinger applies two stacks.

On-attack effects are things that occur when an attack is executed rather than when it hits a target. Coincidentally, Lightslinger itself is an on-attack effect.

Well, Azir's soldiers proc Rageblade last i tried but doesnt proc the nashors/recurve bow effect.

Weird stuff.
Rageblage also stacks with abilities, not just AAs, and each one of azir's soldier's attacks count as an individual spell.
